greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = (n^n + 1)/ (n^(2^a) + 1), where 2^a is the highest power of 2 dividing n.
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..388
example: The sixth term is (6^6 + 1)/ (6^(2^1) + 1) = 1261, since 2^1 is highest power of 2 dividing 6.
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, Jul 24 2000
